title: 6 theaters in hosting watch parties for high-stakes U.S. vs. Mexico soccer playoff

Image 85 of 85 6 theaters in San Antonio hosting watch parties for high-stakes U.S. vs. Mexico soccer playoff 1 / 85 Back to Gallery SAN ANTONIO — At least six movie theaters around San Antonio will show the high-stakes playoff match between the United States and Mexico national soccer teams Saturday night.
The theaters, including Santikos Palladium, Santikos Embassy, Santikos Silverado, Santikos Rialto, Cielo Vista and Cinemark McReless Market, are selling tickets for the event , which is being organized by Fathom Events.
The rivalry game, which is a winner take-all for a berth in the 2017 Confederations Cup in Russia, will be played at the Rose Bowl in Pasadena, California on Saturday with a kickoff time of 8:30 p.m. (San Antonio time).
Nearly 90,000 fans are expected at the game, which will be broadcast live on Fox Sports 1 and Univision.
RELATED: Dos Santos to miss Mexico's playoff vs. US
Theaters showing the game Theaters showing the game The game comes during a rough patch for both teams. El Tri officials fired manager Miguel Herrera days after the team won the CONCACAF Gold Cup this summer.
Pressure is building around U.S. coach Jurgen Klinsmann after the team failed to reach the final of that tournament and played terribly against Brazil in their last match, losing 4-1.
U.S. soccer legend Landon Donovan recently suggested Klinsmann should be fired if the Yanks lose the high-profile match.
The two teams met in a friendly at the Alamodome in April, where the USNMT won 2-0 in front of more than 60,000 fans.
